name: Embassy Suites North Shore / Deerfield

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the 3rd hotel we'd stayed at in 4 nights on the road. After staying at lower-priced hotels it is absolutely true...you get what you pay for. Best breakfast. Quietest room. Best lighting. Best layout of a room with choices of chairs, couches, tables. For the small increase in price, it is absolutely worth it to stay at an Embassy Suites.
reviews.title: A very nice stay at this hotel

reviews.text: Stayed there for buisness and will stay next time. The cooked to order breakfast was good and liked to have a free drinks with my collegauges afternoon in the lobby. Staff is nice the only part I did not like is there is no place to go, no restaurants near the hotel you need to drive.
reviews.title: Nice and comfotable suites

reviews.text: I reserved two rooms with indoor connection, but most of rooms were booked and male staff told me he could only confirm two rooms which were next to each other without indoor connection. We understand this situation and got one room key first. But, when we were back after dinner, the other staff (black short hair female) told us there is no room be next each other. We checked the previous confirmation which male staff did. We understand there could be miscommunication, but her attitude was so rude. We said if two rooms were not next,we had no reason to stay here. She told us again "I don't know." We got mad due to her continuous rudeness. Finally, male staff figured out this issue, but we agreed we will never stay at this hotel again! I hope their staffs have more training how to say to guest.
reviews.title: horrible staff

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times over the last five years and service is always great from front desk to housekeeping. All smile and pleasantly greet you. The rooms we stayed in could use some updating, but the facilities are fine and the breakfast service is beyond compare. They even make their own salsa and it's excellent.
reviews.title: Another Hilton Winner

reviews.text: Location was very quiet, and about a 20 min drive to the Navy base in the early morning. Was a good choice for the family as the rooms are very large. The breakfast was excellent as I have come to expect at Embassy properties. The pool was hardly used by most guests but we used it several times. Really enjoyed being "out of the city" in the evenings.
reviews.title: Good location for a Navy graduation trip

reviews.text: We just completed a Navy reunion at the hotel. We required 60 rooms on our peek nights. A welcome reception,and a business meeting. I could not be more happy with the way the hotel and staff preformed. Carrie LaVigen was my Sales contact. Every day in the morning ,someone from her staff would seek me out . To see if there was any thing we would need for the day.
reviews.title: Old Navy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a Reunion Planer I try to find a hotel that will allow my members to relax and enjoy each others company. This hotel more than filled the bill.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: The hotel is even more spectacular since they have undergone recent renovations. I was here to celebrate my first wedding anniversary and it was amazing. All of the staff members were attentive and helpfule. It is slightly hidden (off of the main road) which makes for an even more romantic stay. SIMPLY MAGNIFICENT!!!!!
reviews.title: Very Nice Facility but Poor Oversight

reviews.text: We went to a Navy Reunion at this hotel, and were very impressed by our large suite. There were mix-ups with our hospitality suite, and we did not have a separate room for our breakfasts. My wife could not get into the swimming pool as advertised at 6 am (engineer was not there yet), and there was chaos in the swimming pool with a middle-school soccer team which the hotel did not come by to check on. The breakfasts were very good, and evening cocktails a nice touch.
reviews.title: An experience you won't forget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed sept.26 to celebrate my husbands bday and the staff was great from the girl that check us in to a room away from the elevator as I had requested to the young lady who was working in the evening that gladly arranged the shuttle to take us to the mall. The shuttle driver that evening provided great customer service I think his name was jerry. The hotel staff even went out of their way to bring my husband some cookies for his bday! It was a great stay and we will certainly be back and let our friends know this is a hotel worth staying.
reviews.title: Reunion success

reviews.text: Enjoyed my stay. I was there for business and found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast was great. Plenty of room to socialize and work. The rooms were great. They are very roomy and clean. We stay again and again.
reviews.title: Very clean.

reviews.text: although business guest oriented, also perfect setup for family reunion with children, 2 room suites, frig, microwave. Includes breakfast in large breakfast area. This particular location has friendly and helpful staff. Enjoyed our stay very much. Only thing that botherws is that they charge for interne.
reviews.title: great place for family reuinion

reviews.text: Spent a week here a part of a group conference that was off site. Evening 2 hr reception as sweet. Hotel shuttle was nice, taking us to/from local resturants. No worry to drive. Quiet area, nothing within walking distance so you have to drive anywhere.
reviews.title: Embassy Suites Deerfield Great evening reception, clean rooms, nice!

reviews.text: This is an older Embassy, and it's beginning to show some aging. The carpeting in the room has seen better days. The only thing updated in this suite was the shower, and it had been retiled and it was nice.
reviews.title: Older Embassy Suites w/ below restaruant

reviews.text: Housekeeping was good, employees were ok, but nobody stuck out as exceptional like you usually find at Hilton Properties. At checkin, I asked about my free upgrade for "diamond" members, and she said they could not because the hotel was booked full. I find that very hard to believe, because when I got back from doing business at 10 PM the lot was half empty. So I just think she didn't care to do it, or doesn't like doing that for frequent Hilton customers.
reviews.title: J & P review
Good and dependable!
reviews.text: We checked in for a girl's weekend and we were very comfortable. The linens were very nice and the towels were fluffy and very white! I really enjoy staying at Embassy Suites because of the value and the comfort. I like the living room area rather than sitting on the beds to visit.

reviews.title: very clean hotel
reviews.text: great location and clean hotel from lobby to rooms. bed was very compfortable. Breakfast was great and clean area. I would recommend this hotel for leisure or business. Location was nice and close enough to have fun at Chicago downtown.

reviews.title: What a great place to stay!
reviews.text: Our youth hockey team spent a weekend at this hotel. They treated us very well. Great rooms, 2 hour happy hour with chilled mugs, and a great breakfast which they opened early for us. If you have a group this is a very nice and accommodating hotel. I recommend you work with Carrie LaVigne <clavigne@destinationhotels.com> for group scheduling. she really went out of her way to make our stay both affordable and accommodating to our schedule.

reviews.title: Great stay!!
reviews.text: My family along with the rest of our hockey team had a great overnight experience. The staff were wonderful and went out of their way to ensure we had a great visit. The happy hour with free drinks and snacks was great perk, along with the made to order hot breakfast, you can't beat it!!! We liked the open lounge area from which you can keep an eye on the kids while they swim. We would highly recommend, and will stay here again.

reviews.title: Great place to stay with a group!
reviews.text: We stayed with our team overnight and the service was outstanding. The facilities were great for our group, with plenty of room to get together at the evening snack bar and great breakfast the next morning that they even opened early for our group. The rooms were a great size and had comfy beds for a good night's sleep! Overall a really nice place to stay.

aka: Embassy Suites North Shore / Deerfield Hotel
description: Stay in the newly renovated full-service all-suite hotel located 14 miles from Chicago’s O’Hare International Airport. Embassy Suites Chicago - North Shore/Deerfield is situated in an excellent location for easy access to several Fortune 500 headquarters, Chicago attractions, world-class shopping and a diverse array of restaurants. Relax in your spacious two-room suite and enjoy a range of home-like amenities such as two flat-screen TVs, a wet bar area with a refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker. Accessible rooms are available.Start your day with a free cooked-to-order breakfast, and savor complimentary beverages and snacks at the Evening Reception*. If you’re busy, Room Service is available from Cadwell's Grille. Take advantage of the hotel’s BusinessLink™ Business Center and express mail service. Hold a meeting or conference in one of the five event venues, and enjoy the range of business amenities and services available.
